Specific Details: Range of engagements regarding use of hybrid connections for embedded generation, which involves combining offshore wind with existing thermal generation stations, to accelerate the delivery of offshore wind to meet Programme for Government targets of 5,000MW by 2030.  Engagements include submission of a proposal on items to consider in relation to the MAP Bill, & separate engagements in relation to a proposal for DECC to engage with CRU/EirGrid, emphasising the criticality of the approach.
DPOs Lobbied: Eamon Ryan|Minister|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Paul Kenny|Special Adviser|Department of Environment, Climate and Communications::Claire Byrne|Councillor|Dublin City Council::Mary Fitzpatrick|Senator|Seanad::Steven Matthews|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Brian Leddin|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Seán Kelly|MEP|European Parliament::Ciaran Cuffe|MEP|European Parliament
Subject Matter: Range of engagements regarding use of hybrid connections for embedded generation, which involves combining offshore wind with existing thermal generation stations, to accelerate the delivery of offshore wind to meet Programme for Government targets of 5,000MW by 2030.  Engagements include submission of a proposal on items to consider in relation to the MAP Bill, & separate engagements in relation to a proposal for DECC to engage with CRU/EirGrid, emphasising the criticality of the approach.
Intended Results: Seek support for proposals that would facilitate inclusion of hybrid connections for offshore generation projects as ‘relevant projects’ (or progress in an equivalent manner) in order to accelerate delivery of offshore wind targets, including engagement by DECC with CRU/EirGrid to enable these connections to compete in RESS 1 Auction with a view to delivering a more competitive auctioning process with greater potential to hit the ambitious 5GW by 2030 target at a lower cost to the customer
Lobbying Activities:
Engagements include: 
• Referenced in a virtual meeting involving Pat O’Doherty, Nicholas Tarrant, Seán Murphy with Minister Ryan, Paul Kenny SPAD, Claire Byrne Cllr Dublin City Council and others on 3/3/2021
• Letter 23/4/2021 from Jim Dollard to Martin Finucane PO 
• Virtual meeting involving Padraig O’Hiceadha / Seán Murphy with Senator Mary Fitzpatrick on 21/1/2021 
• Engagements by Seán Murphy with Steven Matthews TD including virtual meeting on 15/1/2021; call on 9/2/2021; text on 17/2/2021
• 2-5 calls and related email on 9/2/2021 with Chair and members of the Oireachtas Committee on Housing by Seán Murphy 
• Virtual Meeting on 30/4/2021 between Seán Murphy and Brian Leddin TD
• 6-10 calls with Paul Kenny Special Advisor starting 15/1/2021 and including presentation on 15/4/2021
• Skype meeting on 29/1/2021 involving Peter O’Shea / Seán Murphy with Seán Kelly MEP & related email from Seán Murphy on same date
• Skype meeting on 2/2/2021 of P O’Shea / S Murphy with Ciaran Cuffe|Virtual Meeting|11-20
Person primarily responsible for lobbyin: Pat O’Doherty, CEO, ESB; Nicholas Tarrant Executive Director Engineering & Major Projects, ESB; Jim Dollard, Executive Director, Generation & Trading, ESB •	Peter O’Shea, Head of Corporate & Regulatory Affairs, ESB; Padraig O’Hiceadha, Strategy & IT Manager, Generation & Trading, ESB; Seán Murphy, Public Affairs Manager, ESB
